alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 2:35PM MST until December 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TUESDAY TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Tuesday morning, south to southwest winds of 15 to 30 MPH, gusting to 45 MPH, are expected along with light rain and snow showers. Tuesday afternoon and evening, a strong cold front will result in a rapid drop in temperatures, possible flash freeze on roadways, and snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches the the Snake Plain and valleys, and 4 to 9 inches above about 5,500 feet. Afternoon winds will increase to west-southwest at 20 to 40 MPH with gusts to 55 MPH. * WHERE...The eastern Magic Valley, Snake Plain, Teton Valley, and southern and eastern highlands, including but not limited to Burley, Sweetzer Summit, Holbrook Summit, Aberdeen, American Falls, Pocatello, Chubbuck, Fort Hall, Blackfoot, Idaho Falls, Rigby, Rexburg, Driggs, Malad Pass, Lava Hot Springs, Fish Creek Summit, Soda Springs, Georgetown Summit, Montpelier, and Border Summit. * WHEN...From 5 AM Tuesday to 5 AM MST Wednesday. While winds will be strong all day Tuesday, the heaviest snow will likely arrive after 1 PM, except after 3 PM in the Snake Plain where precipitation may begin as rain. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick travel conditions due to a possible flash freeze as well as falling and blowing snow, especially Tuesday afternoon and Tuesday evening. Strong winds may also result in difficult driving for high profile vehicles. The Tuesday evening commute could be significantly impacted.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
